thread.title: Elizabeth Warren silenced on Senate floor after quoting Coretta Scott King
thread.title_full: Elizabeth Warren silenced on Senate floor after quoting Coretta Scott King | New York Post

author: Associated Press
title: Elizabeth Warren silenced on Senate floor after quoting Coretta Scott King
text:
In an extremely rare rebuke, @SenWarren gets cut off while reading a letter on the Senate floor https://t.co/Yv94gNcQwg pic.twitter.com/xe43Pbu9pR 
— CNN (@CNN) February 8, 2017 
WASHINGTON — Sen. Elizabeth Warren has earned a rare rebuke by the Senate for — believe it or not — quoting Coretta Scott King on the Senate floor.
The Massachusetts Democrat ran afoul of the chamber’s arcane rules by reading a 30-year-old letter from Dr. Martin Luther King’s widow that dated to Sen. Jeff Sessions’ failed judicial nomination three decades ago.
